title: Drawing, "Costume Design for Red Queen, for Checkmate", 1937
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: E. Mcknight Kauffer
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, line pointing to the first and third cones on crown, right: these two at front plane; arrow pointing to second cone, right: this one at back; arrow pointing to the part under the crown, left: Lacquer Paint black; pointing to right sleeve, right: gold (sleeve); pointing to right leg: bottom at tights / cloack cape can be used / or not.; in black ink, lower right: Red Queen "Checkmate"
creditline: Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer
description: Costume design in red and orange for queen, blonde woman standing frontally with hands near waist, bent at the elbows. She wears a jumpsuit with a gold belt and one gold sleeve, cuffs, and a cape. Her crown is composed of three cones. Lower left, a small version of the model and costume seen from the back.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Costume Design for Red Queen, for Checkmate", 1937.
1937. Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper. Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer. 1963-39-277.
